body.name: Heartless Sky: Zodiac Academy, Book 7
body.description: The winds of fate are shifting, and it finally seems like they’ve been twisted in our favor.On the run and cast out from society, we’ve been forced to hide from the madman who stole our throne. But as more secrets come to light, and my sister and I work harder than ever before to reach our potential and claim our birthright, the end is finally drawing closer. There is no turning from this path now.The curse chases on our heels as time rushes by, and the blood-drenched destiny of the man I love looms ever closer just like the monster who stole our throne. We must prepare for the final battle, but three things are clear now—the cards have already been dealt, blood will spill for a new future to rise, and the stars themselves can’t help us.The fight for the throne is upon us. All hail the heartless sky. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This book was evil.
reviews.reviewText: My whole heart has been ripped from my chest. I have never sobbed as hard as I have in the last 100 pages of this book.I knew that this ending was coming. I knew what lied ahead for our sweet heroes, but the way these authors literally ripped my soul out of my body and sent it beyond the veil was uncalled for. I am not ok and truthfully I think I will need at least 3 business days to recover from this book.Pros:•The absolute love in this book is beyond amazing!•The love between the main characters is literally so spellbinding that it keeps me wanting to continue reading the series.•The heirs, Orion, Geraldine, and the Twins finding peace for the first time in this series was literally the best part of this book.•If I’m being honest, I should have stopped reading this book at chapter 46! It was the best chapter of the whole book and I could have ended this series with that chapter and been none the wiser!•The humor in this book is unmatched! I absolutely love how funny some of these scenes are!Cons:•The whole last 100 pages of this book is the biggest con!•The amount of point of views is insane in this series! Also along those lines, no one and I mean no one wants to be in Lionel Acrux’s slimy head!•Not enough Tory and Darius scenes. They deserved better especially after what these authors put them through.•Lavinia’s curse.•Caleb and Seth’s relationshipIf you decide to read this series, please be warned that you are going to cry so much that you will think you’re crazy and so will your family. Do I recommend this series, yes. Do I think you have to be tough to read it, also yes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I. Am. Wrecked.
reviews.reviewText: I finished this book last night & I was too much of a wreck to write the review at that time. This book had some of the highest of highs, but the last 10 to 20 percent was just brutal, watching all of the characters you've come to adore be smashed on the rocks below that titular Heartless Sky.Before I get deeper into the review, I just have a few words to say about Caroline Peckham & Susanne Valenti. Aside from their obvious sadistic tendencies towards their characters (& therefore our hearts!) & the psychopathic apathy towards their readers' pain (just kidding ... Sort of.... 🤔), these two ladies are absolutely EPIC writers. The world of Solaria is that rarest of gems for readers: a truly original, fully emersive world filled with vividly drawn, relatably flawed characters undertaking the most amazing of adventures. SO much more than just a simple Academy romance. I love these gals, they are so worth the pain they put me through!BE WARNED: FROM THIS POINT FORWARD THERE WILL PROBABLY BE SPOILERS.So, the end of the previous book was pretty grim, & Heartless Sky picks up right where it left off. What follows is about 4\5ths of the book watching things (for the most part) go right for our heroes for once. There were so many of CP & SV's signature hilarious events. It was freaking amazing to see Darius & Tory finally be able to be together & love each other with all of their beings, the way they were always meant to. Not to mention how incredibly rewarding it was, after ALL the hell they've been through, to see Darcy & Orion finally get their divine moment & Orions' power shaming to end. Xavier finally got the best dijazzle & the Dom position in the herd. Kitty & Hamish were so lovely. Caleb & Orion's accidental brotherhood was an unexpected pleasure as well. If only Seth could get his shit figured out & tell Caleb how he feels... especially now that it seems Caleb feels the same way.As always, the book was a great read, but with all of the positivity & beginnings of HEAs, I have read enough of these diabolical ladies' other works to realize it was all way too good to be true. Only this time, instead of sprinkling unbelievable atrocities throughout the book at every turn, CP & SV saved all of the despair, horror, heartache & hopelessness for the final 5th or so if the story. I don't think I have ever read a book during which I cried quite so much. I can't even list all of the times that I had to put my phone down & just let the sobs stop so my eyes would be dry enough to start reading again. Waiting for the final book is going to be a bloody torture, & there are so many hurdles for our beloved Heirs, Vegas, & crew to overcome before we will receive the pleasure of reading the HEA endings these poor, beloved yet beleaguered characters so desperately deserve.Definitely this is the best book in the series so far (but I've pretty much felt that way after reading every single book leading up to this one as well). I just don't know what will be more painful: the agony of what I just read, or the torture of waiting for the release of book 8 & the story's conclusion! Highly, highly recommended!One final thing! Caroline & Susanne, keep up the good work! And give me more of Solaria! I'm awaiting the next book in Darkmore Penitentiary almost as eagerly as I am ZA8 (how could you do that to Roary, after everything he's been through?!) but I've already read Elise's (& Gabriel's & Leon's & Ryder's & Dante's) story. And I would be so sad if this is all we ever get to see of this amazing magical world!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What the what?! What just happened?! Can anything go right for this crew?! So many sad, emotional things took place. Such a grim future. Random good things happened in this story. When I thought things were going to go right for once, events twisted and nothing went right again. I swear the stars really are out to get them all. Spots in this book drug on a little. I know sometimes plot filler is needed but I wanted the action and plot development. It delivered! Book 8 now!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Just tell the story, not penthouse letters
reviews.reviewText: If you take away the very graphic hetro, homo, and beastiality from the book it would cut out 30 or 40% of the content leaving a story that doesn’t really progress from where the last book ended.The only thing these authors like more than tawdry pornography is making sure the bad guys run the table at the end of every book while the good guys may have minor success but it is rarely significant nor do their successes actually improve the overall plot.What started out as Twilight meets Harry Potter meets 50 Shades has just turned into straight porn with a little story about how badly the good guys got whupped in between sex scenes. It is tedious.

Las estrellas parece que siempre se interponen en el camino de la felicidad de las protas, por un lado les dan armas y por el otro las destruyen…La muerte siempre sigue sus pasos y los de todos los que ellas aman…

I made it through this behemoth of a book for the third time and loved it just as much as the first time! This time I listened to the audio and these narrators are absolutely fantastic. There is a huge cast of characters in this series that all have their own POV chapters and these narrators have such great distinct voices for each character that I always know who is speaking. Absolutely recommend the audio, especially for a reread!So many amazing and heartbreaking things happened in this book. Something I’ve been waiting for from the beginning finally happened and a new potential relationship emerged which excites me so much. However, just like all the other books in this series it is full of heartache. The ending was absolutely crazy. One scene actually had me crying (which might not be the scene everyone would think).Now that I’ve finished my reread I can finally get to book 8!!! I can’t believe I’m only going to get to it 6 months after release but better late than never and at least it’s before book 9 is released! Wish me luck!

reviews.reviewText: Loved all of the Zodiac Books, but this one has had me, shouting out support for Xavier, Crying for Darcy and Orion. I Would love to see these books on film 🎥 All I can say is thank you and I can't wait to read the last of the Zodiac books.
